oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Immunization of Bulls for the Control of Vibriosis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kendrick, John W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: vibriosis
Campylobacter fetus
immunization of bulls
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: (Summarized from a presentation at the Annual Meeting of the American Association of Bovine Practitioners at San Francisco, Calif., in December 1976.) The disease we know as vibriosis is caused by the bacterium known as Campylobacter fetus. For many years this organism was known as Vibrio fetus. The subject matter of this talk on the immunization of bulls for the control of vibriosis is primarily drawn from the work of others as published in the recent veterinary literature.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1976; 78-79
